record.meta: According to a letter of donation in the manuscript, it was donated to the Universiteitsbibliotheek Utrecht in 1643 by Christianus Ravius Berlinas (1613-1677)
Also contains a letter written and signed by Bjarni Jónsson from 1595 (first flyleaf) and some other short texts (second flyleaf) (; Leaves numbered twice: 2-53 (17th cent.) and 3-54 (later hand)
Copied by a hand identical with the one that wrote AM Dipl. Isl. LX 9 (from 1603)
Tiele & Hulshof 1887-1909, no. 1374 - Van der Horst et al (1984), no. 128 - Anthony Faulkes, Manuscript Trajectinus. The Utrecht Manuscript of the Prose Edda. Copenhagen 1985 (contains facsimile)

According to Faulker, written and owned by Páll Jónsson of Thernuvík in the Western fiords of Iceland in or about 1595. The manuscript has several propriety marks, among which that of Danish professor Ole Worm (1588-1654), who owned it from 1635 to 1637

At the beginning of the manuscript one leaf is missing and at the end 3 leaves are missing. It is not entirely clear whether text was lost at the beginning. (According to Faulkes (p. 10), the first page of the exemplar may have been unreadable.) The text ends defectively at vs. 61 of the Háttalal. In front of the first leaf, there was another gathering of which only the first leaf remains, which functions as a fly leaf. A second flyleaf has been added
Andere literatuur in Utrecht: Jacqueline de Ruiter, Beschrijving van... (staat in de kast), ew. red. avdv
